shortdesc.ph: Sets dual-stream mode on the sender side.

p.codeblock: public abstract int setDualStreamModeEx(Constants.SimulcastStreamMode mode, SimulcastStreamConfig streamConfig, RtcConnection connection);
public abstract int SetDualStreamModeEx(SIMULCAST_STREAM_MODE mode, SimulcastStreamConfig streamConfig, RtcConnection connection);
Future<void> setDualStreamModeEx( {required SimulcastStreamMode mode, required SimulcastStreamConfig streamConfig, required RtcConnection connection});

section.p: The SDK enables the low-quality video stream auto mode on the sender by default, which is equivalent to calling this method and setting the mode to . If you want to modify this behavior, you can call this method and modify the mode to (never sends low-quality video streams) or (sends low-quality video streams).
section.note:
The difference and between this method and is as follows:
When calling this method and setting mode to , it has the same effect as ().
When calling this method and setting mode to , it has the same effect as ().
Both methods can be called before and after joining a channel. If they are used at the same time, the settings in the method called later shall prevail.

plentry.pd: The mode in which the video stream is sent. See .
